definition: (music) playing in a different key from the key intended
details:
noun
- (music) playing in a different key from the key intended
- the act of reversing the order or place of
= synonyms: reversal
- a rearrangement of the relative positions of power lines in order to minimize the effects of mutual capacitance and inductance
= example: a rearrangement of the relative positions of power lines in order to minimize the effects of mutual capacitance and inductance
- (mathematics) the transfer of a quantity from one side of an equation to the other along with a change of sign
- (genetics) a kind of mutation in which a chromosomal segment is transfered to a new position on the same or another chromosome
- an event in which one thing is substituted for another
= synonyms: switch, substitution, replacement, permutation
- any abnormal position of the organs of the body
= synonyms: heterotaxy
